intro: Oreomyrrhis ramosa, commonly known as the ramose oreomyrrh, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. Oreomyrrhis ramosa is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
